Description: Start with mobile styles and progressively enhance for larger screens
Do: Use min-width media queries ascending

Description: Use standard breakpoint values aligned with common devices
Do: sm:640px md:768px lg:1024px xl:1280px 2xl:1536px

Description: Set breakpoints where content naturally breaks rather than device widths
Do: Break where content looks bad not at device widths

Description: Use container queries for component-level responsiveness
Do: @container for components that live in different contexts

Description: Use container query units for fluid sizing within containers
Do: cqw cqh cqi cqb for container-relative sizing
Don't: Fixed px values inside responsive containers

Description: Use clamp() for font sizes that scale smoothly between breakpoints
Do: clamp(min preferred max) for all text sizes
Don't: Fixed font sizes with media query jumps

Keywords: viewport vw heading hero responsive scale
Description: Use viewport units (with clamp) for large headings that scale
Do: Combine vw with clamp for bounded scaling

Description: Limit line length to 45-75 characters for readability
Do: max-width on text containers (65ch ideal)

Keywords: fluid spacing clamp gap margin padding
Description: Use fluid spacing that scales between breakpoints
Do: clamp() for padding/margins/gaps

Description: Use consistent spacing scale (4px/8px base) across breakpoints
Do: Maintain proportional spacing ratios at all sizes

Description: Use CSS Grid auto-fit/auto-fill for automatic responsive columns
Do: auto-fit with minmax for self-adapting grids
Don't: Fixed column counts changed at every breakpoint

Description: Use flex-wrap for natural content flow at any width
Do: flex-wrap: wrap with min-width on children
Don't: Separate layouts per breakpoint for flow content
Code_Good: display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; > * { min-width: 250px; flex: 1; }

Description: Handle sidebar visibility across screen sizes
Do: Overlay/drawer on mobile + persistent on desktop

Keywords: stack horizontal mobile desktop row column
Description: Convert vertical stack to horizontal layout at wider viewports
Do: flex-direction: column on mobile → row on desktop
Don't: Separate components for mobile and desktop

Keywords: responsive images srcset sizes picture art direction
Description: Serve appropriately sized images for each viewport
Do: srcset + sizes for automatic resolution switching
Don't: Same large image at all sizes

Keywords: art direction picture source media crop
Description: Use different image crops/compositions for different viewports
Do: <picture> with <source> for different aspect ratios
Don't: Same landscape photo cropped badly on mobile

Description: Maintain aspect ratios across viewports
Do: aspect-ratio property for consistent proportions
Don't: Hardcoded width/height that distorts on resize

Description: Ensure interactive elements are large enough for touch (≥44×44px)
Do: min-height: 44px min-width: 44px on all interactive elements on mobile
Don't: Small buttons or links with <32px touch area

Description: Differentiate touch and pointer input for interaction patterns
Do: @media (hover: hover) for hover-dependent features

Description: Ensure adequate spacing between touch targets
Do: min 8px gap between adjacent interactive elements

Description: Handle both portrait and landscape orientations
Do: Use orientation media query for layout adjustments
Don't: Locking to portrait-only in web apps

Description: Use dynamic viewport height units to handle mobile browser chrome
Do: dvh for elements that should fill visible area
Don't: 100vh which doesn't account for mobile browser bars

Description: Serve higher resolution assets for retina/HiDPI displays
Do: Use 2x/3x images for HiDPI or SVG for icons

Description: Include print-specific styles for content pages
Do: @media print for clean printable output
Code_Good: @media print { nav footer .no-print { display:none; } body { font-size: 12pt; } }

Description: Use CSS containment for rendering performance
Do: contain: layout style for isolated components
Don't: No containment on large pages with many elements
